body_content.explanation: a situation in which a group, business, army, etc., has all the people it needs:
examples: The army suffered many casualties in battle and was not operating at full strength.
Until we are back to full strength at the restaurant, we may need some team members to cover double shifts.

body_content.explanation: in ice hockey, a situation in which the two teams are each playing with all the players they are allowed to have according to the rules when there are no penalties (= advantages given to the opposing team because a player has broken the rules):
examples: She is a fast skater, which makes her a useful weapon when teams are not at full strength.
After Ryan was released from the penalty box, the teams were at full strength.
